Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)
The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
input
<architecture> {Data} transferred from the outside world into a computer system via some kind of {input device}.
Opposite: {output}.
(1997-04-28)

input n 1: signal going into an electronic system [syn: {input signal}] 2: any stimulating information or event; acts to arouse action [syn: {stimulation}, {stimulus}, {stimulant}] v : enter (data or a program) into a computer
